Articles.Content: What happens to the mods when you update via launcher?

Having a lot of fun so far, the only thing I'd say is that it'd be good if there was a list of science you've done so that you know which experiments you have and haven't done. This would be especially handy with the biome samples, because at the moment you have to keep a manual record of which biomes you've explored so far.

Ok im stuck lol

It says I have a decoupler available in science but not in rocket building area, help ?
Much better. At work I was getting 60 KB/s just before the server crash, now at home I'm getting 2.2 MB/s.
Just did my third mission. Here's a funny picture:

2 hours. I'm stuck here at work for 2 more hours.

<twitch!twitch>

my... my goo needs to be viewed for SCIENCE!
Does anyone know how to use the patcher on OSX 10.8? The icon just opens up terminal for me...
I can't even launch a rocket without it gitching out

And I landed on the Mun. 330 science on that mission.

No technical issues so far.
I love the new career mode. It will be even better when the finances are implemented. Than you will have to REALLY think how to squeeze the most out of every mission! Good work SQUAD!

>300 points? And I thought I was making a progress.

Anyway, this is great fun. The only problem is the lack of electric charge. Communotron really taps the charge like mad, but I guess you can just "observe goo" and "keep data" and then collect everything when you recover the mission.

I got Jebediah to land on the north polar cap. Goo says it's cold there.

So far I only got to orbit Kerbin. You get lots of points for going on EVA, whether you're going orbital or suborbital. Of course, you can't transmit while on EVA.

Back from minmus mission +465 science

Click to enlarge:)

Edited October 16, 2013 by Luxmaster-CZ
Man, this is really something to keep me busy! And it's so much fun!

Its here! On the first mission, I got over 50 science. I could probably have done better in a polar orbit though. It should be possible to get to the MÃƒÂ¼n with the starting parts, which would yield even more science.

Man, this is really something to keep me busy! And it's so much fun!

I endorse this post.

I'm having so much fun, I'm canning my save and doing it again!

Some of the science messages are downright hilarious.

"The less resilient of the samples appear to have splattered around the interior, forming new and interesting color combinations."

This apparently has scientific use.
career mode is awesome!
I would like to thank C7 for continued work on the SAS system. This current iteration is a VAST improvement over 0.21 at first glance.

Just got back from my Munar Flyby:

and:

I think i am done with career mode for today though! It was my first hands-off flyby I did. (no engine burning apart from the burn to get to the moon)

Next mission is a munar orbit and return!

You Squad have really outdone yourself with career mode. I wasn't excited at first hearing about it (yes, still holding out for resources like the other children), but after playing career mode for an hour...wow, 2 hours now.. this is EXACTLY what was needed. Good call. I'm as excited now as I was when I first found KSP (.16) and now I have to explore everywhere haha. You guys did a great and we all appreciate the effort!

BTW: Biome specific experiments = genius!

I endorse this post.

I'm having so much fun, I'm canning my save and doing it again!

Yeah i can only assume for you being limited in parts and trying to get as much done as you can with them is a delight

You Squad have really outdone yourself with career mode. I wasn't excited at first hearing about it (yes, still holding out for resources like the other children), but after playing career mode for an hour...wow, 2 hours now.. this is EXACTLY what was needed. Good call. I'm as excited now as I was when I first found KSP (.16) and now I have to explore everywhere haha. You guys did a great and we all appreciate the effort!

BTW: Biome specific experiments = genius!

THAT IS SO TRUE! I thought I might be dissapointed with career mode, but if you play it without exploiting i can see at least 6-10 hours unlocking the tech tree depending on skill level.

I have just researched thermometers and ladders so far, and im 2 hours in. (also struts )

Now that FAR and KIDS are officially 0.22 compatible, I'm going to scrap my almost fresh save and start from scratch. Hopefully I'll have figured out how to push large payloads into space by the time Interstellar is updated.

Does anyone know how to use the patcher on OSX 10.8? The icon just opens up terminal for me...

Sorry, I'm still on Lion.

It's weird though, the game runs better for me in OS X than it does in Windows, but the patcher has never worked for me (which is why I used my Steam code.) Your safest bet is probably to download the DMG.

Edited October 17, 2013 by Nobody_1707
EDIT: Whoops, we really need a delete button. I did not mean to double post.

THAT IS SO TRUE! I thought I might be dissapointed with career mode, but if you play it without exploiting i can see at least 6-10 hours unlocking the tech tree depending on skill level.

I have just researched thermometers and ladders so far, and im 2 hours in. (also struts )

Yeah unless you're a monster at building giant rockets with basic parts that can go to Duna, ike and back, it'll take a few hours to unlock the tree in the current version, and even once that's done, i still feel like i wanna go and check out what the goo does all around the solar system.
